document_content.title: Referral to General Medicine for Further Evaluation

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Marsh presents with persistent fatigue, intermittent low-grade fever, and unintentional weight loss over the past three months. Initial workup in the primary care setting has not identified a clear etiology.

sections.heading: Relevant Medical History
sections.content: No known chronic illnesses. Past surgical history is unremarkable. No significant family history of autoimmune or malignant diseases. No recent travel or exposure to infectious diseases.

sections.heading: Investigations to Date
sections.content: CBC shows mild normocytic anemia (Hb 10.8 g/dL). ESR and CRP are both mildly elevated. Liver and renal function tests are within normal limits. Chest X-ray is unremarkable. Basic metabolic panel and thyroid function are normal.

sections.heading: Current Medications
sections.content: Occasionally takes acetaminophen for headache. No regular medications.

sections.heading: Request
sections.content: We kindly request a comprehensive assessment in General Medicine to investigate the underlying cause of her symptoms and guide further management.
